intro: Antirrhinum cornutum, commonly known as the horned snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, curled, horn-like bracts that enclose its colorful, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces vibrant red, orange, or yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Antirrhinum cornutum is a popular choice for garden cultivation due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
